data.title: Alfresco delight
data.text:
We enjoyed an awesome breakfast brunch today.  we were promptly seated and followed by our very welcoming waitress  which provided us with a seat outside where we could enjoy the fresh air while dining.

Our  food was savory and the California Benedict  was awesome.  
Highly recommend  for your dining pleasure

data.title: Great Breakfast, Lunch and Coffee Spot!
data.text: Antoine's Cafe is a fantastic restaurant!  They have delicious food and the staff is super friendly.  The coffee is also outstanding.  The establishment has the atmosphere of a Parisian cafe with the added bonus of surfboard decor.  They play fantastic old music that adds to the old fashioned mood.  I highly recommend this spot!

data.title: Awesome place!
data.text: We love this place! Great variety of food. Love the coffee and that I could buy it Highly recommend!

data.title: COFFEE, BAGELS, BREAKFAST FEST
data.text:
Great breakfasts, along with bagels, and croissants.
tasty food, draws a big crowd, but worth he wait.

data.title: Mom and Daughter brunch
data.text: I used to love going to this place when I lived in San Clemente so when I stopped in to visit my mom today and she mentioned going here for lunch I jumped at the chance. They have definitely revamped their menu in the five years since I've been there. Mom was a little disappointed to find out they don't make homemade quiche anymore. So she decided to order a Savory crepe instead and I went for the Antoine's benedict on gluten free bread and had it with a coconut milk cappuccino. My meal was fantastic my mom's on the other hand with nothing to toot a horn about. There was just nothing spectacular about her plate or the presentation or the flavor she said so I didn't even bother taking a picture but I would definitely go back and just not for the crepes

data.title: Best Breakfast in San Clemente
data.text:
Excellent coffee and NY Style Bagels!!!!

Really good omelettes and other breakfast favorites!!!

Hard to beat, but it's gets crowded, so get there early !!!!

data.title: Great spot!
data.text: Great breakfast/brunch spot! Perfect for casual get together with friends or family. Try the veggie croissant, you won't regret it!

data.title: Just Meh....
data.text:
Great location on Del Mar street, but food and service were just 'meh."
Won't be back anytime soon although I live nearby.

data.title: Breakfast!
data.text: Delicious breakfasts...perfect eggs, flavourful sides - even the coffee is especially good. Friendly staff.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: This is my favorite restaurant in San Clemente. Everything is delicious and the Butter Cake is the best!

data.title: A Breakfast Favorite!
data.text: You can sit outdoors, or indoors at either the counter, table or booth. Definitely my favorite breakfast stop in San Clemente, with great specials.

data.title: Whomever recommended the bacon, cheese, and avocado omelette should stick to IHOP.
data.text: This place is not good.  Their hash browns were burnt and dry...tasted like they were sitting from yesterday.  Why there is a line and a full restaurant only speaks to how clueless Orange County diners are in general.  The reason we have soooooo many bad restaurants?   Because there are lots of people with expendable income who don't want to deal with cooking.  So we go out and the quality doesn't have to be there because these places are full anyway.  Show me 1 place in Orange County that has ever been featured on the Food Network?

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: What ever you order for breakfast you're going to love it. A simple bacon and eggs will make your day. It's my breakfast place any day.

data.title: Down Home Atmosphere
data.text: After living in San Clemente for most of our lives, you define your favorites over time.  Antoine's Cafe is right up there at the top of our list.  The friendliness here is unsurpassed, with superb breakfast and lunch menu selections for everybody.  Right on El Camino Real, with both indoor and outdoor seating, you won't find too many diners as pleasant and enjoyable as this gem.

data.title: Five stars all the way!
data.text: Such a nice place to relax and have a nice homey brunch..Food is delicious and uses the best of ingredients. It is in a cute area with a small parking lot. Be prepare to wait as it gets busy on a weekend.

data.title: very good breakfast.
data.text: can get crowded.  sit on sidewalk for people watching.  nice surf hangout for post surf or post swimming

data.title: Gourmet Breakfast
data.text: This restaurant is a favorite with many people. Starting out with the yummiest hot chocolate and then Antoine's Benedict having such flavors; the basil was such a compliment. The biscuits and gravy and hash browns were delicious. The biscuits looked so much smaller than other cafes serve, but it was a totally filling dish. The service was very prompt and the manager and "chef" are to be commended.

data.title: You cant get by with a reputation any more.
data.text: We decided to give it one more try because we had a lack luster lunch here last month. Omelet was dry and hardly had any fillings. Hashbrowns were greasy and didnt taste fresh. We ate about 10:00 on a weekday. Latte was terrible. Bitter, unusaual taste. Waiter told us he was so busy because he was cooking and waiting tables.  Owner brought me a second cup of coffee that was half full and luke warm. I asked for a new cup, but never received it before we were done eating.  People were staring us down for our table - literally standing right next to our table.  The owner should have asked them to wait outside. People were smoking in front and the smell was coming in the front door.  No one working there asked them to move away - even though they were aware of it.

data.title: Great service and great healthy food
data.text: Service was fast and excellent. Great breakfast  options. Healthy vegetarian  options as well. I had the avocado and sprout  bagel and it was really good and BIG. Cute place

data.title: J'aime Antoine's Cafe!
data.text:
This is a great little café where you can grab breakfast or lunch.  The food is excellent and the atmosphere is wonderful and creative!  I love the surfboards propped up against the front wall of the roof outside and all of those little touches that let you know that though you're at the beach in San Clemente, you're also at a restaurant that has been a  labor of love for a wonderful French couple!   Inside, it has just the right blend of original, distinctive palm tree oil paintings amid a contemporary, sophisticated bistro vibe, where comfort is never overlooked.  The servers are locals who are always friendly and strive to please.  
We often order one of their great omelets for breakfast, filled with avocado, mushrooms and cheese, accompanied by a side of grilled potatoes and your choice of toast (we like the English muffins). They have excellent, freshly brewed coffee and if your appetite will still allow, ask for an order of their delicious Nutella/banana crepes topped with a dollop of whipped cream. So, yummy!  And if this still isn't quite enough for you, they are usually featuring one of those fabulous old movies from the 30's or 40's when the stars were truly Hollywood's finest!
